original_title: Air Quality in Colombo at unhealthy levels – Central Environmental Authority
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News1st):  The quality of the air in Colombo has dropped to unhealthy levels The Central Environmental Authority says.
The value of the air quality indicators has increased to 124 units says Deputy Director General of the Central Environmental Authority Sanjaya Ratnayake.
However, as of 11 AM on Saturday (11) the AQI had increased to 155 units.
These units represent the amount of dust particles present per cubic meter of the atmosphere explained Ratnayake.
He also says they believe that a change in the wind pattern blowing into the country from India has given rise to this situation.
